title: How to start my writing career as an article writer of a leading national newspaper - Quora

response.answer_text: Hi! I guess the person who has asked this question wants to be a journalist. Who else would write articles for a leading daily? Well, there are three things a journalist needs -- writing skills, news sense and common sense. If you have these, you may start applying to media houses. While you do not need a degree in journalism to become a journalist, it will not hurt to have one. A journalism course can instill news sense in you and help clean up your writing. Also, journalism schools offer internships with media houses. I know of many who have landed jobs with big newspapers or channels after interning with them for a while.  All you need to do during an internship is work like you are an employee of the organization. Be of help and fit in -- they'll hire you. It could also be that this question has been asked by someone aspiring to be a columnist. Well, it is only after years of reporting or editing that one can hope to be a columnist. Or maybe you should do something so spectacular that newspapers would want you to have a column with them.

First of all start writing. Initiate. Go for some creative writing course if you are not pursuing it in you graduate studies.Try to get some experience by internships. And keep on writing. Try out reaching for national dailies when you would have some substantial work that you have done all this while to show. But write now ypu have to see where you fit in. And keep on writing. Read what other columnist write. Question if you agree to their point or not. Reseach on issues that you are comfortable with. All the best.P.S  Once you get the job please do send the sweets. :-D
Do not give up Go on writing . Keep watching the trend of magazines and Newspapers. keep sending your articles to good Newspapers and magazines. One day you will kick start your desired career
